articles.headline: ‘Super PACs’ Take On New Role, Organizing Voters
articles.snippet: Super PACs, which in the past typically funneled money into advertising, are branching out into the purview of campaigns — signing up voters at the grass roots.
articles.abstract: Super PACs, which in the past typically funneled money into advertising, are branching out into the purview of campaigns — signing up voters at the grass roots.
articles.lead_paragraph: IOWA CITY — College students supporting Rand Paul for president were out in force going door to door in this university town recently, using their iPad Minis to help identify Republicans committed to voting for the Kentucky senator in next year’s Iowa caucuses.

articles.headline: What Uber Can Learn From Airbnb’s Global Expansion
articles.snippet: Uber’s strategy, in contrast with the home-sharing service Airbnb, has been an aggressive catch-me-if-you-can attitude — one that has put it at odds with many regulators.
articles.abstract: Uber’s strategy, in contrast with the home-sharing service Airbnb, has been an aggressive catch-me-if-you-can attitude — one that has put it at odds with many regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, the home-sharing service Airbnb had more than 40,000 listings in Paris, making the French capital the company’s most popular destination for travelers looking to rent a room or an entire apartment. Paris officials applaud it for bringing innovation to the city’s hotel industry.

articles.headline: CVS Health Quits U.S. Chamber Over Stance on Smoking
articles.snippet: The move comes after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.
articles.abstract: The move comes after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: The CVS Health Corporation said on Tuesday that it would resign from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce after revelations that the chamber and its foreign affiliates were undertaking a global lobbying campaign against antismoking laws.

articles.headline: Bill Cosby Admission About Quaaludes Offers Accusers Vindication
articles.snippet: The acknowledgment came in a deposition the entertainer made in relation to a woman’s lawsuit against him, which was made public on Monday.
articles.abstract: The acknowledgment came in a deposition the entertainer made in relation to a woman’s lawsuit against him, which was made public on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: She was 19 and visiting her mother when, Therese Serignese recounted later, she met Bill Cosby in the gift shop at the Las Vegas Hilton in 1976.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley and Ravi Somaiya

articles.headline: Germans Forget Postwar History Lesson on Debt Relief in Greece Crisis
articles.snippet: As policy makers know well — and Germany perhaps better than any — major debt overhangs are solved only by writing down the debt. And the longer the delay, the deeper the pain.
articles.abstract: As policy makers know well — and Germany perhaps better than any — major debt overhangs are solved only by writing down the debt. And the longer the delay, the deeper the pain.
articles.lead_paragraph: As negotiations between Greece and its creditors stumbled toward breakdown, culminating in a sound rejection on Sunday by Greek voters of the conditions demanded in exchange for a financial lifeline, a vintage photo resurfaced on the Internet.

articles.headline: Vouchers Help Families Move Far From Public Housing
articles.snippet: An experimental program that increases subsidies for families who move to more expensive areas is based on research showing that ZIP codes matter to future success.
articles.abstract: An experimental program that increases subsidies for families who move to more expensive areas is based on research showing that ZIP codes matter to future success.
articles.lead_paragraph: PLANO, Tex. — Lamesa White and her four children moved in February from the most dangerous public housing project in Dallas to a single-family home in this affluent suburb. On the day she left, one of her daughter’s old schoolmates was shot to death.

articles.headline: Market’s Dive Could Delay Economic Reforms in China
articles.snippet: China has been introducing changes in its banking sector and at state-owned companies, but the pace of reforms could slow if the market slump persists.
articles.abstract: China has been introducing changes in its banking sector and at state-owned companies, but the pace of reforms could slow if the market slump persists.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China’s stock market tumble has presented the government of President Xi Jinping with a searing test of its commitment to overhaul the country’s financial system and open up the state-controlled economy.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Chris Buckley

articles.headline: Cutting Jobs, Microsoft Turns Page on Nokia Deal
articles.snippet: The company will shed more than 6 percent of its workers and take a charge against earnings related to its acquisition of Nokia’s smartphone business.
articles.abstract: The company will shed more than 6 percent of its workers and take a charge against earnings related to its acquisition of Nokia’s smartphone business.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When Microsoft announced its deal to acquire Nokia’s mobile phone business, Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive at the time, boasted that the deal was a “bold step into the future.”

articles.headline: China’s Efforts Fail to Contain Market Plunge
articles.snippet: Despite further steps by Beijing to calm trading, shares plunged, extending a rout that began last month.
articles.abstract: Despite further steps by Beijing to calm trading, shares plunged, extending a rout that began last month.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As the Chinese stock market slumps, the country’s government has stepped in boldly, unveiling a series of measures to prop up shares. But those efforts have done little to stabilize the market, with stocks continuing to slide on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Antony Jenkins Ousted as Barclays Chief Executive
articles.snippet: The British lender is the latest in Europe to replace its top executive, as banks adjust to tighter regulatory scrutiny and move beyond legacy issues.
articles.abstract: The British lender is the latest in Europe to replace its top executive, as banks adjust to tighter regulatory scrutiny and move beyond legacy issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A retail banker by trade, Antony Jenkins was elevated to the top job at Barclays three years ago to radically reshape an aggressive investment banking culture at the British lender that politicians and some investors saw as out of control.

articles.headline: Oratory on Confederate Flag in South Carolina Legislature Shows Deep Divisions
articles.snippet: State legislators, inching toward a decision, rejected a slew of amendments meant to slow down a bill that would remove the Confederate battle flag from the Capitol grounds.
articles.abstract: State legislators, inching toward a decision, rejected a slew of amendments meant to slow down a bill that would remove the Confederate battle flag from the Capitol grounds.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C. — The drama in South Carolina’s graceful Greek Revival capitol unfolded on Wednesday with a jangle of the solemn and the absurd, a mix of state history, Southern history and family history that grew more passionate as the day wore on.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Obama Unveils Stricter Rules Against Segregation in Housing
articles.snippet: The regulations are a piece of President Obama’s effort to address the racial disparities he says are helping fuel unrest in American cities.
articles.abstract: The regulations are a piece of President Obama’s effort to address the racial disparities he says are helping fuel unrest in American cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration announced an aggressive effort on Wednesday to reduce the racial segregation of residential neighborhoods. It unveiled a new requirement that cities and localities account for how they will use federal housing funds to reduce racial disparities, or face penalties if they fail.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Binyamin Appelbaum

articles.headline: The Problem With China’s Efforts to Prop Up Its Stock Market
articles.snippet: When a government tries to intervene in these cases, it can mean pouring money down a sinkhole and merely delaying an inevitable correction.
articles.abstract: When a government tries to intervene in these cases, it can mean pouring money down a sinkhole and merely delaying an inevitable correction.
articles.lead_paragraph: Repeat after me: The stock market is not the economy. And the economy is not the stock market.

articles.headline: The Stock Market Bell Rings, Computers Fail, Wall Street Cringes
articles.snippet: The exchange, the world’s largest for stocks, says an “internal technical issue” prompted a shutdown of trading for nearly four hours.
articles.abstract: The exchange, the world’s largest for stocks, says an “internal technical issue” prompted a shutdown of trading for nearly four hours.
articles.lead_paragraph: Problems with technology have at times roiled global financial markets, but the 223-year-old New York Stock Exchange has held itself up as an oasis of humans ready to step in when the computers go haywire.
